content.description: The short slab on the right end of the Remnants block appears dirty but has worthwhile stuff. The left side of the slab is a more technical, thin V1 while the line to the right has slightly better holds.
content.location: The slab on the right end of the Remnants Boulder. This wall is the first thing you will see as you approach Remnants from City Dump.

content.description: Couple of variations on this one, as there are on nearly every climb at Den Rock. The line is a series of jugs up the steep central part of the Remnants Boulder's face. Start as low as possible and make long moves on jugs to gain a stance below the lip. Escape left and top out easily or move right to the little overhang and execute a difficult mantle (probably V2). However you do it, this is a nice warmup with good holds and fun moves.
content.protection: Pad. Landing is flat. Walk off.
content.location: On the Remnants Boulder, one of the leftmost edges of climbable rock. Hike past all the walls to City Dump, then take a trail down and left. The boulder will be immediately apparent.

content.description:
This is a 12 foot boulder which faces east.  Not much.  It is included for completeness. 

  L->R: 

  A. Gang Plank, 8.   B. Moment Of Inertia, 10 or V1.   CB. alternate start to B, 5.   D. Simian Swing, 4.   E. Wall End Slab, V0-1. 

  Above this is another smaller boulder facing east. 

  L->R:   A. unknown, 5.   B. unknown, 8.
